item.title: Frankfurt International Airport “Rhein-Main“ (FRA), Germany – Renovation Baggage Claim
item.dc:creator: javier
item.content:encoded:
Frankfurt International Airport “Rhein-Main“ (FRA), Germany – Renovation Baggage Claim Hall

Fraport AG commissioned the Renovation of  the Baggage Reclaim Hall in Frankfurt’s international airport. With the Construction Cost: of approximately € 15m, the new hall now has a capacity of 17.000 m² in area.  EWL team members have provided services of Preliminary, Detailed and Final Design, Coordination with local Authorities, Tendering Assistance and Construction Supervision. We did this by using our expertise in Architecture and Structure and Electro- Mechanical Installations.

item.title: Al Ain Airport (AAH), United Arab Emirates New Maintenance Hangar for A330 Refuelling Aircrafts
item.dc:creator: javier
item.content:encoded:
Al Ain Airport (AAH), United Arab Emirates New Maintenance Hangar for A330 Refuelling Aircrafts

Abu Dhabi Airport Authority commissioned a new maintenance hangar for the Al Ain airport located in the UAE. With a construction cost of €34m the new hanger holds the dimensions of; 148m / 90m / 27m (L/W/H). Our team members provided services of: Conceptual Facilities Planning of Preliminary, Schematic and Final Design and Preparation of Tender Documents.  We did this using our areas of expertise in:  Architecture and Structure, Electro-Mechanical Installations of Airport Specific Systems and Airfield Ground and Flood Lighting.

item.title: Saarbrücken International Airport, Germany – New Maintenance Hangar
item.dc:creator: javier
item.content:encoded:
Saarbrücken International Airport, Germany – New Maintenance Hangar

Flughafen Saarbrücken Besitzgesellschaft mbH financed the construction cost of € 240,000. Our team members have been involved in reviewing the design services of Preliminary, Basic, Detailed and Structural for the building as well as design of technical Building Equipment. We did this using our areas of expertise in Architecture and Structure, Electro-Mechanical Installations and Airport Specific Systems. Our team have access to all the latest software to ensure the Clients requirements are met by the supply chain.

item.title: Bangkok Airport “Suvarnabhumi“(BKK), Thailand – New Passenger Terminal Complex
item.dc:creator: javier
item.content:encoded:
Bangkok Airport “Suvarnabhumi” (BKK), Thailand – New  Passenger Terminal Complex

The New Bangkok International Airport (NBIA) was extended  with a new terminal complex. With a construction cost of €900m circa. the terminal provides for 45m passengers annually. Our team members have provided Design reviews, Technical Specification options, Construction Supervision and Safety Management. We were commissioned for our expertise on: Architecture, Building and Structure, Technical Equipment (HLS, ELT), Airport Specific Systems, Landside (access road) and Baggage Handling.

item.title: Dubai Airport, U.A.E
item.dc:creator: javier
item.content:encoded:
Dubai Airport, U.A.E

Dubai International Airport is Middle East’s premier and busiest airport. With Abu Dhabi expanding, ACI traffic statistics still ranks Dubai as one of the fastest growing airports in the world. The Phase II Dubai Airport project expansion is comprised of three main projects; Terminal 3, Concourse 2 and Car Parking.  Each of the three buildings has a footprint that is approximately 500m wide by 1,000m long. Our team members have supported the Client during the design and coordination services for the project.

item.title: Khartoum New Int’l Airport (KNIA), Sudan Passenger-, Hajj-, President- and GA-Terminal for New Greenfield Airport
item.dc:creator: javier
item.content:encoded:
Khartoum New Int’l Airport (KNIA), Sudan Passenger-, Hajj-, President- and GA-Terminal for New Greenfield Airport

The Civil Aviation Authority of Sudan commissioned the construction of a new terminal in Khartoum, Sudan. With a capacity of 90,000 m² terminal area, our team members provided the following services; Preliminary and Detailed Design, Tendering, Project Management and Construction Supervision. Our teams’ areas of expertise used were: Architecture and Structure Technical Equipment (HLS, ELT) and Airport Specific Systems Landside (parking, approach road, access road).

item.title: Kuwait International Airport (KIA), Kuwait New Terminal 2
item.dc:creator: javier
item.content:encoded:
Kuwait International Airport (KIA), Kuwait New Terminal 2

Located in Kuwait, the Directorate General of Civil Aviation financed the construction of 85,000 m² of a new terminal area for 11 million passengers per year.  For this project, our team provided the services of Terminal Master Planning, Feasibility Study, Financing Investigation and Concept, Space and Functional Planning. We used our team’s technical expertise in: Architecture and Structure, Baggage Handling Landside and Airside Access to ensure that correct facilities were provided.

item.title: Bangalore New International Airport – Airport Development
item.dc:creator: javier
item.content:encoded:
Bangalore New International Airport – Airport Development

Our team supported BIAL Bangalore International Airport in the first phase, to review the work undertaken by Architect KMP.  This technical support focused on the architectural and engineering services for the terminal building, all other airport related buildings, the airside and landside facilities including infrastructure. In a second phase, we provided design review services during design, construction and commissioning phase. The entire project design and construction cost was approx. € 290m.

item.title: Berlin Brandenburg Int’l Airport (BBI), Germany. Airside Services for the New Airport
item.dc:creator: javier
item.content:encoded:
Berlin Brandenburg Int’l Airport (BBI), Germany. Airside Services for the New Airport

EWL team members assisted Flughafen Berlin Schönefeld GmbH (FBS) to commission the construction of the new airside services for the Brandenburg Airport. Costing approximately €1,700m. Our team members provided the project services of: Preliminary, Detailed and Final Design, Tendering Assistance and Construction Supervision, Geology, Survey, Health & Safety Engineering, Environmental Planning including simulation of Air Traffic. We used our areas of expertise, such as Airfield (RWYs, Aprons, TWYs), Drainage, 400 Hz, Airfield Ground Lighting, Fuelling, NAVAIDS, PCA, Apron Flood Lighting, Docking Systems, Fencing, Airside Roads and Security Systems.

item.title: Flughafen Xi`An Xianyang International (XIY), China – Strategic Consultancy Services for the Airport Operator
item.dc:creator: javier
item.content:encoded:
Flughafen Xi`An Xianyang International (XIY), China – Strategic Consultancy Services for the Airport Operator

Our team reviewed and provided Strategic consultancy services for the airport operator, which included a Master Plan Revision Study, a Revision Traffic Forecast Study and design for the overall airport extension concept. Our team’s area of expertise used were Airside Terminal and our knowledge in Landside access systems.
